title: Round Robin Scheduling
subject: Operating Systems
theory:
Basis of time-sharing systems. Each process gets a small unit of time (**Time Quantum** q, e.g., 10-100ms). 
If valid, it runs. If unfinished, it's preempted and put at back of queue.

examples.code:
If q is large -> FCFS.
If q is tiny -> Context Switch overhead dominates.
examples.explanation: q must be larger than switch time.
